longInfo:
Passport required.
- Nationals of Germany are allowed to enter with expired (max.
  1 year) passports, National ID Cards and Child's travel
  document in lieu of passport (Kinderausweis). 
- Passport replacing documents issued to nationals of Germany
  (other than National ID Cards and Child's travel document in
  lieu of passport (Kinderausweis)), must be valid for the
  period of intended stay.
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card issued to nationals of
  Germany.
- Holders of a Travel Permit Issued in Lieu of Passport
  (Reiseausweis als Passersatz). It is recommended to hold
  some other form of identity documentation to facilitate
  identification; or 
  Travel Permit Issued in Lieu of Passport for Entry into the
  Fed. Rep. of Germany (Reiseausweis als Passersatz zur
  Einreise in die Bundesrepublik Deutschland).
- Holders of a German Child's travel document in lieu of
  passport (Kinderausweis). A photo is required for children
  over 10 years of age.

VISA NOT REQUIRED.

Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Germany will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
- All minors who are nationals of Germany are expected to hold
  their own travel document.
Additional Information:
- Nationals of Germany staying in Switzerland for more than 3
  months must apply for a residence permit.
- Geneva airport (GVA) is located by convention in
  Switzerland
